Speaker: BUSH
Sents: The great middle that defines our country will have a chance to be able to pursue their dreams as they see fit.

Speaker: BUSH
Sents: That should be the great challenge and the great opportunity for the next president of the United States, to forge consensus to go back to a high-growth strategy.

Speaker: BUSH
Sents: And then we'll be able to lead the world.

Speaker: BUSH
Sents: Without a high-growth strategy, our country will never have the resources or the optimism to be able to lead the world, which the world desperately needs our leadership.

Speaker: BUSH
Sents: [applause]

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: Well, I turned 13 years old two days before Ronald Reagan was first elected.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: A lot of people forget this, but just a few days before that election 1980, he was behind in the polls.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: And I think what changed things was people in America realized they didn't want to hear what was bad about America, they wanted to know how it was going to be better.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: Ronald Reagan wasn't just a conservative Republican, he was an eternal optimist in the American people.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: And I am too.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: So here's what I think will make America better.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: We need to live in a world where our children are free, are free from the threats of radical Islamic terrorism.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: We need to live in an America where we have an economy, where everyone can live their piece of the American dream, no matter what that dream is.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: And we need to live in an America where we have a federal government that is not too big to fail, but ultimately small enough to succeed, where we send powers back to the states and back to the people.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: That's what I did in Wisconsin.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: We took on the big government union bosses, the big government special interests, many of whom came in from Washington, to spend millions of dollars to try and take me out because we stood up to them, we didn't back down in any of those instances.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: If you give me the chance as your next president, I won't back down any day, anyway, anyhow.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: I'll fight and win for you and your families every single day I'm in office.

Speaker: WALKER
Sents: [applause]

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: I think what this nation can be and must be is symbolized by Lady Liberty and Lady Justice.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: Lady Liberty stands tall and strong.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: She is clear-eyed and resolute.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: She doesn't shield her eyes from the realities of the world, but she faces outward into the world nevertheless, as we always must.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: And she holds her torch high, because she knows she is a beacon of hope in a very troubled world.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: And Lady Justice, Lady Justice holds a sword by her side, because she is a fighter, a warrior for the values and the principles that have made this nation great.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: She holds a scale in her other hand.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: And with that scale she says all of us are equal in the eyes of God.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: And so all of us must be equal in the eyes of the law and the government, powerful and powerless alike.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: And she wears a blindfold.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: And with that blindfold she is saying to us that it must be true, it can be true that in this country, in this century, it doesn't matter who you are, it doesn't matter what you look like, it doesn't matter how you start, it doesn't matter your circumstances, here in this nation, every American's life must be filled with the possibilities that come from their God-given gifts.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: One nation, under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all.

Speaker: FIORINA
Sents: [applause]

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: Well, as president, I will make this a nation that will solve problems.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: And how?

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: By having the elected officials and the leaders realize they're Americans before they're Republicans or Democrats.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: I did it in Washington.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: And I've done it in Ohio by having the elected officials realize that they're Ohioans before anything else.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: Secondly, I will rebuild the relationships and show the respect to our allies around the world.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: We have no choice but to do that.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: We will be stronger when we are unified.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: And we'll fight for freedom and for human rights.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: And finally, a little bit of what Carly said.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: The people that are out there listening, America was never great because we ran America from the top down.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: America is great because we have run America from the bottom up, where we all live in the neighborhoods.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: One more time in America, we need to revive the concept of citizenship, where everybody's actions make a huge difference in changing the world.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: We have a Holocaust memorial on our state house grounds.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: And there is one line on there that stands out all the time.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: "If you've saved one life, you've changed the world."

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: We need to adopt that as citizens and rebuild and reinspire our country.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: Thank you.

Speaker: KASICH
Sents: [applause]

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: I turned 18 in 1980, and my first vote was for Ronald Reagan.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: Boy, am I glad I did it.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: And I think the country is, too.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: A Christie presidency won't be about me.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: It will be about you.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: Tonight, you sit at home in your living room, frustrated that you play by the rules, you pay the taxes, you do the hard things to raise your family, yet you feel like America's generosity is being taken advantage of.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: That you've been — system is being gamed, and that you're turning out to fall further and further behind.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: Our presidency — our presidency — will be about ending that, about enforcing the law, level the playing field for everybody, and once again reward those folks who play by the rules, and think that justice means more than just the word.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: But it means a way of life.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: And I will tell you this, around the world, I will not shake hands with, I will not meet with, and I will not agree to anything with a country that says death to us and death to Israel and holds our hostages while we sign agreements with them.

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: It will be an America that be strong and resolute, and will once again be able to stick out its chest and say, "we truly are the greatest nation in the world, because we live our lives that way, each and every day."

Speaker: CHRISTIE
Sents: [applause]
